file_content.text: Ladies and gentlemen of the Senate, I present the Barsen'thor of the Jedi Order, and defender of the Rift Alliance.
In my predecessor's place, I have invoked the protocol of special requital, which ensures the Rift Alliance will be properly rewarded.
Several billion credits for rebuilding, privileged access to new hyperspace routes, extra support for your armies--these are only the beginning.
Thank you, Supreme Chancellor. We sought only to serve.
Quite the honor.
Which should also ensure the Rift Alliance worlds never think of seceding again.
A shrewd political move.
You're a quick study.
Given what the Republic has suffered, that seems extraordinarily generous.
Can we afford that?
I consider it both a reward and an investment.
The resources of the Core Worlds are stretched, but we will try to grant any additional requests you have.
Herald. Esh-kha were outsiders, but fought to death for us. Should reward their courage.
Hallow Voice and his warriors deserve to be part of the Republic they defended.
Give them Republic membership.
Yes. We would be a voice in your great chorus.
You and your warriors have more than proven yourselves.
What would serve you and your warriors best?
Ask away, Hallow Voice.
A new foundation, to rebuild. A shared place to grow and intertwine.
You wish to... begin a colony? Of course, I'm sure there are plenty of worlds that would welcome you.
The Esh-kha have earned the chance to begin again on a new homeworld.
They deserve their own planet.
An entire planet? There may be a few possible candidates....
But grass to tread, and peaceful skies? A rebirth? We would bask gloriously in this!
Hey, don't forget the Voss commandos. They lost their Mystic.
Gaden-Ko spoke. Mystics must teach. New Jedi must come to Voss. To learn. We ask this.
You fought with honor; you've earned any reward you desire from the Republic.
Nothing for yourselves?
Gaden-Ko wished this. We ask in his place.
Hey hey hey, what about the Voss commandos? And Gaden-Ko?
Commandos will be honored. I hope for learning. New Jedi to come to Voss. Mystics can teach.
The Mystics could greatly expand our conception of the Force.
We could learn a great deal.
We must be exceptionally careful who we expose to Voss ideas.
Gaden-Ko, the entire Republic stands ready to grant whatever request you desire.
That's all you want?
You have been generous. This is my duty.
Masters? I know you had concerns about the Voss.
The Council may not agree.
The Voss are more... gray than we would like. We will consider this carefully.
One Force. Jedi know dark and light. Mystics know gray. The pivot between. We can show.
The Rift Alliance no longer requires day-to-day oversight, but they'll need a spokesperson in the Senate. Someone invested with your authority.
Why, Supreme Chancellor, it'll be an honor.
Not your decision, Alauni. And I'd be better. Less arguing.
What? I have twice the executive experience and--Jedi, tell them!
As you can see, Representative Shuuru has the passion and drive necessary for the job.
Shuuru would be best.
Exactly. Thank you, Jedi.
Duin is a stabilizing influence. He would be ideal as our representative.
Give Diab Duin the post.
Will do what I can.
Representative Alauni would be perfect for this position. Besides, she's already accepted.
I nominate Alauni.
I'll be certain the Republic knows the debt it owes.
Nadia Grell, representative for Sarkhai, would like to speak.
Alongside reinforcements, we held off an Imperial assault and drove them out of our home system. We stand ready to help the Republic rebuild.
We missed you, Padawan.
Welcome back.
We did our best without you, Master.
I was afraid I'd never see you again.
I'm glad you're alright.
I thought the same. It's so good to be wrong.
I hope you were careful with the forces entrusted to you.
And my troops?
They don't have a scratch. Well, maybe one or two. The Imperials weren't happy to be ambushed.
This is a small part of the greater victory you engineered, yet you've asked nothing for yourself.
You may not have heard. We lost Gaden-Ko in the final assault.
Gaden-Ko is dead.
I didn't know. I'm sorry. But without those soldiers, we--I don't even want to imagine it.
An Imperial fleet attacked, and we couldn't repel them. Our capital city's a smoking ruin. Two... two million dead, at least. Thousands missing.
You owe me the truth. Was it worth it?
I want to know, Master. Was it worth it?
I am sorry. But without those tragic losses, we could never have stopped the Children of the Emperor.
Yes. You saved us all.
We have to work together to ensure your people's suffering was not in vain.
We must make sure of it.
Then... let's look to the future. We'll need help to stand on our own again, but we'll remember what part we played.
You've accepted the responsibility of a terrible decision. You deserve something for yourself.
Your devotion to the light, and your diplomatic talents, make you perfect to fill the empty seat on the Jedi Council.
If you can't accept necessary casualties, you and your people don't belong out in the galaxy.
This is war. Grow up.
How couldn't I see what you really are? I actually thought I....
So this is what you really are.
Ahem. Despite your opinions, you have done a great service to the Republic, and that should be recognized.
Your adherence to the light side, and the truth--however you phrase it--suggest you as a candidate for the Jedi Council.
I will do my best to serve the order in this role, Master Satele.
I accept, gladly.
You have the rare gift of true balance, accepting both contemplation, and action. You would be perfect to fill the empty seat on the Jedi Council.
To me, that seat will always belong to Syo Bakarn.
I can't replace Master Syo.
Syo can never sit on the Council again. But he should know his position will be filled by someone utterly trustworthy.
Jedi, do you honestly think Syo would have wanted anyone else to take his place?
If this is the path the Force has set before me, I am content.
Then I accept.
Being stuck on Tython doesn't appeal to me.
I don't want a "desk job."
Perhaps it is time the Council became less... insular. You'll be free to act as the Force directs you.
Your relentless pursuit of the First Son merits a unique position. We would like to make you our special military advisor.
You will rank alongside us, but work with the Republic, to capture the remaining Children and prepare for any future threat from the Sith.
Rank alongside? So I would not be a member of the Jedi Council.
No Council position?
We would prefer you to focus on assisting the Republic, rather than on Council duties.
I will accept this duty, Master Jaric.
That will suit me.
I wouldn't want to be held back from the front lines.
Only if I can keep fighting.
As special military advisor, your deployment will be your business.
But this is only a small reward beside the great service you have done, for all of us.
We all suffered under the Empire's onslaught. But we have not only survived, we have grown.
Let us look forward.
Is struggle to sharpen an edge.
I am only one person, among millions from across the galaxy, who stood up in the face of evil and said "no."
This is a shared victory.
Though some said it more vociferously than others.
Complacency is a luxury we can never afford again. A threat can come from within, as well as without.
We must remain vigilant.
Wasn't planning on dropping my guard yet.
Keeping one open eye is wisdom.
The Republic is entering a new age. And in victory, our values--justice, compassion, equality--grow even more important.
Adhere to our principles.
At least let us boast a little, Jedi.
Tharan, shush, I want to record this!
We cannot forget those who paid the ultimate price for us. We carry the burden of living up to their sacrifice.
Remember the fallen.
I owe it to father.
Those are big shoes to fill, but we can try.
Now is our chance to consolidate this victory, while the Empire is weak. This is our moment, to build a Republic stronger than ever before.
We must seize this time.
Yes, while the Empire's out of tricks.
There's no shortage of new allies to help us out.
But in the end, this success belongs to all of us. May that spirit of cooperation continue. Thank you.
We did this together.
Words can only do so much. Our actions, from now on, must speak for us. Thank you all.
I've said my piece.
The battle never truly ends, but our cause is worth any cost. Never forget that. Thank you.
Fight for what's right.
Let's go. We belong out there, not in here.
Let's leave them to it, for now. We've got a galaxy waiting for us.
Future is yours again, Herald.
May the Force be with you. Always.
I won't stand and be counted alongside you. Excuse me, sirs. You can find me with my people, where I belong.
